title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
AT&T and Verizon rebuffed a request from federal transportation officials to voluntarily delay the launch of new 5G wireless services extending a showdown that could lead to potentially disruptive U.S. flight restrictions as soon as this week.

---

The rapid spread of Covid-19's Omicron variant is weighing on U.S. businesses, keeping more workers home sick or quarantining and leading some companies to cut services and reduce hours.

---

Twitter permanently suspended one of Rep. Taylor Greene's verified accounts, citing repeated violations of the social-media platform's Covid-19 misinformation policy.

---

Tesla said it delivered more than 936,000 vehicles globally in 2021, an 87% surge from deliveries the previous year.

---

IKEA said it would increase the prices of its products as the furniture giant grapples with rising transport and raw-materials costs.

---

Apple secured the top spot for phone sales in China for a second straight month in November, according to market-research data.

---

Huawei said revenue dropped by nearly a third in 2021, as the effects of U.S. export restrictions hit the Chinese tech giant's main business lines.

---

Mortgage lenders issued a record $1.61 trillion in purchase loans in 2021, according to estimates by the Mortgage Bankers Association.
